places.heading: Maasai Market
places.description: A vibrant open-air market showcasing traditional Maasai arts, crafts, jewelry, and souvenirs. It's a great spot for shopping and experiencing Kenyan culture.

places.heading: Nairobi City
places.description: Kenya's capital and a bustling urban hub blending modern skyscrapers with cultural and historical landmarks, including national parks and museums.

places.heading: Giraffe Center
places.description: A conservation center dedicated to the endangered Rothschild giraffe. Visitors can interact with and feed giraffes in a safe environment.

places.image: /photos/Dreaming of the perfect summer escape_ ðŸŒž Discover the best Eastern African coastal getaways that offer luxury, adventure, and breathtaking views! From Zanzibar's serene beaches to the tranquil shores of Diani Beach, we've got your ultim.jpeg
places.heading: Diani Beaches
places.description: Located on Kenya's southern coast, these pristine white-sand beaches are renowned for their turquoise waters, coral reefs, and luxury resorts.

places.heading: Nairobi Safari Walk
places.description: A nature trail offering a close-up experience of Kenya's wildlife, including lions, cheetahs, and rhinos, in a simulated natural environment.

places.heading: Tsavo National Park
places.description: One of Kenya's largest national parks, famous for its diverse wildlife, dramatic landscapes, and iconic red elephants.

places.heading: Vasco da Gama's Pilar
places.description: A historical landmark built by Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama in 1498, marking Malindi as an important stop in his voyages.

places.heading: Nairobi National Museum
places.description: A cultural and historical museum displaying Kenya's rich heritage, including exhibits on anthropology, paleontology, and local art.
